Zahi Hawass expressed deep gratitude toward the protesters who helped protect the Cairo museum Saturday. They stood beside me. They know this museum is their cultural heritage. This could have been the blackest day of my life, but thank God, we are protecting the sites. Nonetheless, Egypt specialists in the United States are working hard to learn what sites might be damaged or endangered.
